briefTitle: Trial to Evaluate the Effect of Nabiximols Oromucosal Spray on Clinical Measures of Spasticity in Participants With Multiple Sclerosis
officialTitle: A Randomized, Double-blind, Placebo-controlled, 2-way Crossover Trial to Evaluate the Effect of Nabiximols Oromucosal Spray on Clinical Measures of Spasticity in Patients With Multiple Sclerosis
conditions: Spasticity in Participants With Multiple Sclerosis
summary: This study will be conducted to evaluate the effect of multiple doses of nabiximols as adjunctive therapy compared with placebo on a clinical measure of velocity-dependent muscle tone in the lower limbs (Modified Ashworth Scale Lower Limb Muscle Tone-6 \[MAS LLMT-6\]) in participants with multiple sclerosis (MS) who have not achieved adequate relief from spasticity with other antispasticity medications.

primaryOutcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Lower Limb Muscle Tone-6 (LLMT-6)
primaryOutcome.timeFrame: Baseline (predose Day 1 of Treatment Period 1) up to Day 51 (end of treatment of Treatment Period 2)
